intro.description: This Cheat Sheet brings an example of use of the DICE Simulation Tool

item.title: Create a new Papyrus project
item.description: First of all, you need to have a Papyrus project created. If you don't know how to do that, it is recommended to execute first the Cheat Sheet "DICE Framework -> DICE Papyrus -> Create a Papyrus project and model" and then come back to this Cheat Sheet

item.title: Apply MARTE and DICE profiles to the model
item.description: The model should be profiled using the MARTE and DICE profiles. For DICE, only DPIM profile, and for MARTE, MARTE_AnalysisModel profiles. There exists a Cheat Sheet for this purpose too "DICE Framework -> DICE Papyrus -> Profile and Stereotype Papyrus models". Execute it and apply these profiles to the model. Then come back to this Cheat Sheet

item.title: Create 2 diagrams to the model
item.description: Two new diagrams should be created in the model. Open it and add a Deployment diagram and an Activity diagram from the Model Explorer view

subitem.label: Create the Deployment diagram
Create the Activity diagram

item.title: Complete the Deployment diagram
item.description: The Deployment diagram should be completed adding some elements

subitem.label: Add a "Node" element from the palette
Add an "Artifact" element inside the created Node

item.title: Complete the Activity diagram
item.description: The Activity diagram should be completed adding some elements

subitem.label: Add an "Initial Node" element inside the Activity

Add an "Activity Partition" element inside the Activity. Open the Properties view, select the UML tab and set the property "Represents" to the Artifact created in the previous step. Use the "3 points" button and browse the tree model until you found the desired element
Add an "Opaque Action" element inside the Activity Partition
Add an "Activity Final Node" element inside the Activity. This element is placed in the same entry of the Initial Node in the Palette
Add a "Control flow" link between the "Initial Node" and the "Opaque Action"
Add a "Control flow" link between the "Opaque Action" and the "Activity Final Node"

item.title: Stereotype the Deployment elements
item.description: There are some elements in the Deployment model that should be stereotyped. Follow these steps

subitem.label: Select the "Artifact" element, and go to the Properties view and select the Profile tab. Add a <<PaLogicalResource>> stereotype
In the <<PaLogicalResource>> stereotype, browse its properties and set the value of the "poolSize" property to 1

item.title: Stereotype the Activity elements
item.description: Also, some elements in the Activity model should be stereotyped. Follow these steps

subitem.label: Select the "Opaque Action", and go to the Properties view and select the Profile tab. Add a <<GaStep>> stereotype

In the <<GaStep>> stereotype, browse its properties and set the value of the "hostDemand" property to "(expr=0.6,unit=s,statQ=mean,source=est)". This is a MARTE known value format for the duration of the activity in seconds
Select the "Initial Node", and go to the Properties view and select the Profile tab. Add a <<GaWorkloadEvent>> stereotype

In the <<GaWorkloadEvent>> stereotype, browse its properties and set the value of the "pattern" property to "open=(arrivalRate=(expr=$rate, unit=Hz, statQ=mean, source=est))". This is a MARTE known value format for the work load
Select the "Activity", and go to the Properties view and select the Profile tab. Add a <<GaAnalysisContext>> and a <<DPIMscenario>> stereotypes
In the <<GaAnalysisContext>> stereotype, browse its properties and set the value of the "context" property to "out$responseTime" and "in$rate".
In the <<DPIMscenatio>> stereotype, browse its properties and set the value of the "respT" property to "(expr=$responseTime, statQ=mean, source=calc)".

item.title: Configure the launching
item.description: In this step, the launching should be configured in order to obtain valid results.

subitem.label: The configuration can be launched from the menu "DICE Tools -> DICE Simulation Tool", or right click over the model in the Project Explorer, click on Run As... and DICE Simulation entry
In the configuration window of the selected model, there is a section group for the Variables and the given Values. Here you must select the Rate variable and set as value "1".
Finally, if all the configuration is valid, you can run the configuration and see the results if all gone ok

item.title: See the results of the launching
item.description: If the configuration gone ok, the final step is to see the results.

subitem.label: Open the view to see the results. In the menu "Window -> Show View -> Other -> DICE Simulation -> Invocations Registry"
Double click over the identifier of the simulation
A tree editor will be opened showing the results of the execution. It can be found the calculed response time in the simulation
